bow: the nurse at wic made me feel weird about my decision to formula feed rant 35 weeks pregnant and today had wic appointment for my four year old daughter and the nurse asked me if needed help choosing pump for breastfeeding and told her no and when she asked why told her planned on formula feeding she took her glasses off and gave me this weird look and asked me why and just told her it was the best choice for us some background my daughter was breastfed until she was three months away from turning two years old she self weaned we did pump we did use bottles she was 100 exclusively breastfed do not mention these things to brag and want to make it clear that it was horrible for almost two years my body was not my own we saw the three lactation nurses our hospital had we had two opinions from pediatricians that were not our own and we tried four different breast pumps from three different brands over the course of three months eventually the lactation nurses agreed that yeah pumping was gon na work and could either supplement with formula or continue doing 100 boob we went 100 boob after only one can of formula because she did drink any it was wasteful and would end up losing money that did have ended up doing therapy sessions because was becoming increasingly irritable uncomfortable anxious and depressed from all the sitting and touching had to do also had not so lovely childhood trauma that made it hard for me to breastfeed being stay at home mom was the easiest thing ve ever done and hated it wanted to go to school and go to work and could and it was becoming difficult to be the mother my daughter needed therapy helped us through this when she weaned therapy helped us with an unexpected aftermath how hated to be touched did like holding her did like to be tugged on or climbed on or cuddled or anything hated hugging friends and family hated sitting next to people gritted my teeth and beared it but was miserable after being on antidepressants and talking through it every two weeks with my therapist those thoughts went away was happy hopeful and ambitious again loved to cuddle my daughter and greet everyone knew with hug and not fake smile it was great now really do want to explain this to every person nurse doctor whatever every time mention that formula feeding and not going to unless it my regular doctor or therapist or my baby doctor so this is how the rest of our conversation went nurse why is it the best choice me well it just wo help me be the best mom that can be besides that going to school this fall and ca wait to get back to work there are loads of women in this town that breastfeed and still go to work and still breastfeed so why ca you what about the baby father ca he just go to work so you can stay home and work on breastfeeding me we ve talked this through and it the best choice for us but there are so many benefits to breastfeeding *pulling out pamphlets* me oh know breastfed my first for almost two years so why not this baby me said it not the best choice for us this time after this stopped her and asked if we could carry on the appointment and got out of there as quick as could but it made me feel so uncomfortable know going to be questioned lot about my decision but only going to answer in depth to my therapist and baby pediatrician do shame mothers for breastfeeding especially in public so should be shamed for choosing to formula feed this is what best for my family and it what best for me to be good mother and think that all that matters in the end your feelings are totally valid wic promotes breastfeeding though so just be prepared again in the future lot of women are as educated as you who go in there and they want to help it hard as moms when we are questioned get it it was
